meanings.definition: A medieval weapon resembling a spear with a curved blade.
meanings.sent1: The knight wielded his glaives with skill in battle.
meanings.sent2: The glaives were displayed in the museum alongside other ancient weapons.
meanings.sent3: During the renaissance fair, the actor accidentally dropped his glaives, causing laughter among the audience.
meanings.sent4: The glaives gleamed in the sunlight, ready for combat.
meanings.sent5: The glaives, sharp and deadly, were feared by all who faced them.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'glaive', referring to multiple instances of the weapon.
meanings.sent1: Legends speak of warriors who carried multiple glaives into battle.
meanings.sent2: The armory was stocked with various glaives for the soldiers to choose from.
meanings.sent3: At the festival, vendors sold toy glaives for children to play with.
meanings.sent4: The glaives lined up in rows, creating a formidable sight.
meanings.sent5: The glaives, in their numbers, struck fear into the hearts of the enemy.
